this week we've got reports from Taiwan semiconductor Black Rock Netflix some big Banks and more so let's not waste any time guys I can't wait to jump into this with you let's go ahead and jump by 16% and more importantly net income profit soared by almost 40% with both figures beating analyst estimates too we're looking at subscribers average revenue per user Rose 7% That's thans uh thanks to uh price increases and a Crackdown on password sharing while Subs still put up 16% growth even despite that you know you might expect steps to be going down well they had 16% growth that helped although I don't think Amazon actually releases those numbers so I would I would bet that they're probably a lot higher but uh either way it's an impressive feat for uh Netflix and of course they're Diversified businesses of companies like Amazon Disney apple or even Google with YouTube who all give me that exposure to streaming but are still you know going to be much larger more Diversified and have so many other things going on with them to where you know if streaming struggles they still got everything else lifting them up so I prefer those a lot more now I will say though uh I got to admit you know Netflix is looking pretty good so far though but uh the stock actually for the week it actually fell a little which is a little surprising but uh I think it's really because it was trading already so high near a record high it Rose by so much recently and yet what is also kind of surprising though is that the valuation is still pretty cheap thanks to their huge EPS growth of more than 20% a year Seeking Alpha puts their PE much higher than the sector but their peeg is a bit lower and again that's just because of the growth that they're still expected to have in the future it's still not a stock that I'd want to own myself though but uh you know for how isolated they are within streaming I actually think they're doing just about as good of a job as they can do right now

moving on to Tuesday though we had actually uh continuation of big Banks reporting with Bank of America T symol BAC uh this is coming off of last week where we had Chase and Wells Fargo report which nation's uh largest bank so to still be growing at that rate that's pretty incredible now CEO Jamie Diamond did warn about the risk of higher than expected inflation you know continuing and uh as well as our continued High interest rates too that putting pressure on the economy could possibly lead to a recession and of course big Banks would just banks in general would probably get crushed during a recession that would include Chase too so a little bit of a warning there from uh the banks the biggest America's biggest bank uh CEO now as for Bank of America that's the nation's second largest bank well their performance was nowhere near as impressive at least in my opinion as Revenue news were almost flat year-over-year although EPS at least did beat Expectations by 5% there are some reasons to be optimistic though about bac's future particularly in their growth that they're seeing from their digital platforms including their AI virtual assistant Erica and the cash Pro app both of which continue to see members user engagement and transaction volumes rise the cash Pro app in particular saw more than a 40% rise in payments which is very strong they also saw strength in the zel payment platform which has been growing in popularity I've been seeing a lot of people using that myself I even use it myself too uh but however that is not solely owned by Bank of America instead it's actually owned by a collection of seven of the largest banks anyway off of the back of Chase's strong performance BAC did enough to impress investors to lift up the stock by over 4% this week also leaving It Up near an all-time high after a very strong past year as for me though I prefer Chase for the stronger business and US Bank Corp for the bigger dividend as bac's financials have uh really there so with bac's valuation already quite a bit higher than the sector I'd just rather look elsewhere if I want some exposure to finance right now

moving on to Tuesday though we had actually uh continuation of big Banks reporting with Bank of America T symol BAC uh this is coming off of last week where we had Chase and Wells Fargo report which by the way Chase in particular had a very strong showing beating analyst estimates with Investment Banking Rising by over 50% and total revenue storing by over 20% that's huge for what is already the nation's uh largest bank so to still be growing at that rate that's pretty incredible now CEO Jamie Diamond did warn about the risk of higher than expected inflation you know continuing and uh as well as our continued High interest rates too that putting pressure on the economy could possibly lead to a recession and of course big Banks would just banks in general would probably get crushed during a recession that would include Chase too so a little bit of a warning there from uh the banks the biggest America's biggest bank uh CEO

After that though we also had United Health Report on Tuesday super popular healthcare insurance uh company and stock who is actually the number one largest health insurance company in the US by sales and they just continue to put up very strong performance with this latest quarter being no exception revenues Rose 6% up to nearly hundred billion doar that's crazy while EPS soared by over 10% as well uh both figures beat expectations too although it wasn't by much but they were also dealing with several challenges this year including a Cyber attack that disrupted many healthcare services and ended up costing them billions of dollars as a result overall though UNH continues to benefit from secular trends like the Aging baby boomer population that will now see one out of every five US citizens at retirement age by 2030 and of course you know as people get older they will require more healthare uh and insurance and things like that on top of that though investments in Ai and other technological advancements seem to be paying off for United as their Tech division opum Health saw the highest growth of all at a double digigit 133% rise in sales up to$ 27 billion now with also operating margins that continue to improve because of which they reaffirmed full year Guidance with the stock also climbing by over 10% this week in reaction very strong performance unfortunately the stock has already risen up by nearly 600% in the past decade up to a record high so I've been a little too shy myself to buy in at these levels plus I'm not sure how the growing cause of a kind of Medicare for all type of system would impact an Ensure like United if that was ever implemented in the future but with double digigit EPS growth expected annually going forward a surprisingly still very reasonable valuation about the same peeg as a sector and even a little dividend to top it all off I can definitely understand why so many investors love to own this stock it is still a pass for me though

but moving on to Wednesday we had the medical devices and prescription drugs giant Johnson and Johnson report ticker symbol G uh J&J uh pretty good results from them 6% rise in sales and a whopping 133% rise in net income and both figures beat estimates by around 4% each J&J of course spun out their consumer drug segment Ken view recently that houses Tylenol and other popular brands like that but uh it looks like the smaller more streamlined business is doing just fine without it in particular with their medical devices and prescription drug segment putting up solid growth in Pharmaceuticals dar Al X and stara both put up double digit growth and are already doing billions of dollars per quarter each that's out standing while their medical device and Technology business has also been fueled lately and that really should continue well into the future too by recent acquisitions of more than $30 billion worth so they're making big moves to get uh you know get larger thanks to the strong performance the stock also Rose another 3% plus this week but while it may appear to be an expensive stock trading near an all-time high the fact is that J&J has actually been pretty suppressed for a long time now only up 55% in the past decade with a valuation that is also significantly cheaper than the sector and a 3% dividend that's been grown for over six decades in a row too even though I don't own J&J myself I would probably rate it a buy here I think they're doing pretty well even with the challenging macroeconomy so uh yeah kind of like what I'm seeing from J&J

after that though we also had US Bank Corp report this is the other big bank that I own besides Chase uh mostly for the dividend but they saw their stock rise by over 6% this week despite results that may not look all that impressive at first glance as sales actually fell a bit in the quarter but I think investors just kind of felt like the stock was already pretty cheap to begin with it's about flat in the past 10 years and the other thing you have to consider is that they are having a bit of a correction year right now as after all the growth that they gained last year from the acquisition of Union Bank so now you have a 2% fall in sales expected this year but then you know 4% rise expected next year too so it's kind of leveling out it's correcting and for the quarter they also noted higher credit card volumes and a stabilization in loan delinquencies that are helping them more than expected credit card uh debt is kind of alarming me though I've been keeping an eye on it more lately and we just have insane l of credit card debt I think a lot of consumers are using credit cards and uh I'm a little worried about what that might mean for the future but uh might be a little bit off topic there but just kind of going back here to earnings um when looking at US Bank Corp stock another thing about them they also have a pretty cheap valuation PE and peeg ratio is pretty low both are lower than Bank of America and most of their other peers and they also have a great dividend it's yielding over 4.3% that's what I like most about US Bank courp I already bought my shares though at much lower levels mostly during the um banking crisis of last year so I'm not looking to buy any more shares at this time myself but I am glad to see it performing well and I continue to hold what I already have
